name: Questions Bank, Assignments.txt - Screening round
description: This section outlines the screening process for potential candidates, which includes multiple rounds of evaluation. The screening round assesses the candidate's knowledge and skills in various areas such as DevOps leadership, Linux and networking, architectural exposure, AWS cloud, Kubernetes, Docker, and handling zombie processes. The machine/coding round tests the candidate's problem-solving approach by presenting them with multi-level questions related to either Linux or Kubernetes, based on their area of expertise. The Linux/networking round evaluates the candidate's understanding of the underlying systems of Linux and networking, which is crucial for troubleshooting incidents and designing systems.
capabilities: AWS cloud, Kubernetes, and Docker expertise evaluation
Linux filesystem, DNS, HTTP, and TLS knowledge assessment

name: Questions Bank, Assignments.txt - Machine/Coding Round
description: This section discusses the importance of evaluating a candidate's knowledge and experience with cloud platforms, particularly AWS, and various DevOps tools. It emphasizes the need for candidates to be familiar with AWS services like EC2, S3, and RDS, or at least have experience with other cloud providers, as the company heavily relies on cloud platforms. The section also aims to assess the candidate's ability to handle systems at scale by examining their experience with DevOps tools and the scale of use cases they have worked on.
use_cases: Evaluating candidate's familiarity with AWS services like EC2, S3, RDS
Assessing candidate's potential to learn new cloud stacks
Analyzing candidate's experience with DevOps tools
Determining candidate's ability to handle systems at scale

name: Questions Bank, Assignments.txt - Linux/Networking
description: This section discusses the importance of architectural design skills for senior team members. It emphasizes the need for experienced professionals who can guide the team in designing well-architected and secure infrastructure systems, such as logging/monitoring systems or secure infrastructure setups. The section suggests that these architectural exposure questions assess the candidate's thinking process, experience level, and potential contributions to the team.
use_cases: Assessing a candidate's architectural design skills
Evaluating a candidate's experience level and potential contributions

name: Questions Bank, Assignments.txt - Cloud/Platform/Tools
description: This section appears to be an introduction or overview for a round of interviews or assessments aimed at evaluating a candidate's suitability for a specific role and organization. It suggests that the purpose of this round is to assess the candidate's fit within the company's culture and requirements.
use_cases: Evaluating candidate fit for a role
Assessing candidate alignment with organizational culture
Determining candidate suitability for a position
